questions.text: What does the "Y" in YWCA stand for?
questions.explanation:
Young.

	The YWCA is the Young Women's Christian Association. Their two goals are to empower women and eliminate racism. Unlike the YMCA which is a business, the YWCA is a nonprofit organization.

Year of the Monkey.

	The 12 animals in the Chinese zodiac are dog, pig, rooster, dragon, ox, sheep, horse, rabbit, snake, monkey, rat and tiger.  Other years for the monkey include 1992 and 2004.

questions.text: Which of the following movies was Tom Hanks in with Meg Ryan?
questions.explanation:
You've Got Mail.

	"You've Got Mail" is a remake of the movie "Shop Around the Corner". There is also a musical with the same plotline called "She Loves Me." Tom Hanks and Meg Ryan also starred together in "Joe Vs the Volcano" and "Sleepless in Seattle."

questions.text: What is the title of the "Cheers" episode in which Sam Malone sails Robin's yacht in a race?
questions.explanation:
Yacht of Fools.

	"Cheers" was on air from September 30, 1982 until May 20, 1993.

questions.text: Which of the following "Young" men was a quarterback for the San Francisco 49ers?
questions.explanation:
Young, Steve.

	Steve Young got his degree in law from BYU in 1994. Steve Young started originally with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers before he was traded to the San Francisco 49ers.

questions.text: What is the name of a popular e-mail server that starts with Y?
questions.explanation:
Yahoo & yahoo.

	Yahoo was started by two men in a trailer many years ago according to their page www.com/info/values.

questions.text: According to the cooking show, who "Can Cook"?
questions.explanation:
Yan.

	Martin Yan's father owned a restaurant in China before he was born. They later moved from China to Hong Kong. Martin Yan does at least one children's cooking show every year because he believes children should learn how to cook at a young age instead of adults doing everything all the time for them.

questions.text: What is the name of a type of ox from Tibet?
questions.explanation:
yak.

	In the winter Yak's can survive temperatures as low as -40F.

questions.text: In Spanish it's "si", in French it's "oui", in Japanese it's "hai" what is it in English?
questions.explanation:
yes.

	Yes in other languages:Dutch - ja; German - ja; Italian - si; Portuguese - sim.

questions.text: What is the name of the Yoda equivalent in the movie "Spaceballs"?
questions.explanation:
Yogurt.

	Yogurt is played by Mel Brooks. He also plays President Skroob, as well as off the set where he directed, wrote, produced, and did the music for the song "Spaceballs".
